intro: Sauvagesia rosacea, commonly known as the rose-scented sauvagesia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its root system is fibrous, allowing it to thrive in well-drained soils. Sauvagesia rosacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
